column4: i want to dualboot windows 7 with ubuntu.. i have ubuntu installed to use the whole disk... its a 200gb hdd.. can i safely resize it to 100gb?
fairly fresh install
yes, as long as you do so from the livecd
of course you should always backup first
i am using live usb.... i have gparted open on the computer i am doing it to
so noway to dual boot?
all my data is on a separate hddso i am not worried about data loss
i just want to resize and dualboot
i have resized it and it rebooted fine.. i'm not trying to install windowson the newly partitioned free space..wish me luck
desktop
now*
4gb
runs great on it. i have never rezized and dualbooted from ubuntu before tho
i have 200 gb hdd that i am dual booting on.. all my files are saved to 500gb.. soon to upgradeto 1tb tho :)
just wondering how itsgonna load seeing that ubuntu was installed first.. is it gonna grub or is windows gonna take over?
canu get anything to install on it?
damn typo's i hate typing on a netbook
when dual booting win7 and ubuntu does it matter what os is installed first?
what happened?
#ubuntu
its a good idea to install Windows first as it will overwrite grub if installed second, causing issues
